almost.functional.utils
Class Iterables

java.lang.Object
  almost.functional.utils.Iterables

public final class Iterables
extends java.lang.Object

Utility operations on an iterable.

forEach

public static <T> void forEach(java.lang.Iterable<T> iterable,
                               Consumer<? super T> consumer)
Accept a consumer for each element of an iterable.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the iterable and consumer
Parameters:
consumer - the consumer to accept for each element
iterable - the iterable

reduce

public static <T,R> R reduce(java.lang.Iterable<T> iterable,
                             R initial,
                             BiFunction<R,? super T,R> accumulator)
Perform a reduction of an iterable, using an initial value, and a two argument function. The function is applied to each element using the last result as the first argument and the element as the second.

Type Parameters:
T - type of the iterable elements and accumulator's second argument
R - type returned by reduce, the accumulator and it's first argument
Parameters:
iterable - the iterable.
initial - the initial value of the first argument.
accumulator - the two argument function.
Returns:
the final result of the function.
Since:
1.5

find

public static <T> Optional<T> find(java.lang.Iterable<? extends T> iterable,
                                   Predicate<? super T> predicate)
Apply a predicate to an iterable, returning an optional of the first element where the predicate is true, or empty if no true is found.

Type Parameters:
T - they type of the iterable and predicate
Parameters:
iterable - the iterable to traverse
predicate - the predicate to test
Returns:
an optional of the first element where the predicate is true, or empty if no true is found.

any

public static <T> boolean any(java.lang.Iterable<T> iterable,
                              Predicate<? super T> predicate)
Determine if any element of an iterable matches a given predicate.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the iterable and predicate
Parameters:
iterable - the iterable to traverse
predicate - the predicate to test
Returns:
true if any element matches the predicate, otherwise false.

contains

public static <T> boolean contains(java.lang.Iterable<T> iterable,

Does an iterable contain a value as determined by Object.isEqual(Object, Object).

Type Parameters:

Parameters:

value - the value
Returns:
true if iterable contain a value as determined by Object.isEqual(Object, Object).

map

public static <F,T> java.lang.Iterable<T> map(java.lang.Iterable<F> fromIterable,
                                              Function<? super F,? extends T> function)
Create an iterable that maps an existing iterable to a new one by applying a function to each of it's elements.

Type Parameters:
F - the type of the original elements, and the argument to the function
T - the type of the resulting iterable, and the result of the function
Parameters:
fromIterable - the iterable to be transformed
function - the function to apply to the elements
Returns:
an iterable that transforms an existing iterable by applying a function to each or it's elements.

filter

public static <T> java.lang.Iterable<T> filter(java.lang.Iterable<T> fromIterable,
                                               Predicate<? super T> predicate)
Create an iterable that filters an existing iterable based on a predicate.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the elements
Parameters:
fromIterable - Iterable being filtered
predicate - the predicate to base inclusion upon, true cases are included, false excluded
Returns:
iterable of filtered elements

iterable

public static <E> java.lang.Iterable<E> iterable(java.util.Enumeration<E> enumeration)
Convert an enumeration to an iterator.

Type Parameters:
E - type of the enumeration
Parameters:
enumeration - the enumeration to make into an Iterator
Returns:
An Iterable
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if enumeration is null

get

public static <E> Optional<E> get(java.lang.Iterable<E> iterable,
                                  int position)
Return an optional of an element from a specified position in an iterable. If the position is out of bounds an empty optional is returned. Positions start at 0.

Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements
Parameters:
iterable - the iterable
position - the position
Returns:
an optional from the given position, or empty if out of bounds
Since:
1.7

last

public static <E> Optional<E> last(java.lang.Iterable<E> iterable)
Return the last element of an iterable, or empty if the iterable is empty.

Type Parameters:
E - type of the iterable elements
Parameters:
iterable - the iterable
Returns:
Optional of the last element, or empty if nothing in the iterable
